intro: Diplotaxis brassiciformis, commonly known as the African mustard or false mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features alternate, linear to lanceolate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are contained in long, slender pods, and the plant is known for its peppery taste, similar to that of mustard. Diplotaxis brassiciformis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
